title: 110_s2812
content: The Medicare Telehealth Improvement Act of 2008, also known as the Act, includes provisions such as an increase in the types of originating sites and expanding the practitioners eligible to provide telehealth services. It aims to improve the process for updating the list of telehealth services. The Act expands the types of originating sites for telehealth services, including skilled nursing facilities, renal dialysis facilities, mental health centers, and other sites with a telecommunications system. Additionally, certain originating sites are exempt from facility fees. The Act expands telehealth services to include more originating sites and exempts certain sites from facility fees. Amendments made by this section will apply to services provided 90 days after the Act's enactment. Expansion of practitioners eligible to furnish telehealth services. Expansion of practitioners eligible to furnish telehealth services. Section 1834(m) of the Social Security Act is amended to include various practitioners such as physical therapists, occupational therapists, speech-language pathologists, and audiologists as eligible providers for telehealth services. The amendments allow additional practitioners to provide telehealth services, including audiologists, certified providers, and other individuals determined appropriate by the Secretary. Effective 90 days after enactment of the Act. The amendments allow more practitioners to offer telehealth services, such as audiologists and certified providers, as determined by the Secretary. This includes improving the process for updating the list of telehealth services. The Telehealth Advisory Committee will provide recommendations to the Secretary on adding or deleting services and HCPCS codes for telehealth. If a recommendation is not implemented, the Secretary must publish a statement in the Federal Register explaining the decision. The Telehealth Advisory Committee, composed of 7 members appointed by the Secretary, including practicing physicians and non-physician healthcare providers, will recommend additions or deletions of services and HCPCS codes for telehealth payment authorization under the Social Security Act. Members must have prior experience with telemedicine or telehealth practice. The Telehealth Advisory Committee, consisting of 7 members appointed by the Secretary, must have prior experience with telemedicine or telehealth practice. The committee will meet twice a year and ensure representation of various specialties and geographic regions. Members will serve for terms specified by the Secretary, and the Federal Advisory Committee Act will not apply. The Telehealth Advisory Committee, with 7 members appointed by the Secretary, must have experience in telemedicine. The committee will meet twice a year, ensuring representation of specialties and regions. The Secretary will establish the committee despite any limitations on advisory committees.
